help_text.message:
Selection Rectangle Highlighting - Help
General usage
By clicking the Selection Rectangle Highlighting icon in the Chrome extension bar (usually to the right of the address bar) you activate the highlighting mode. You can draw selection rectangles by clicking and holding down your mouse button in any area of the current page. The extension needs to be activated on every page/tab you want to use it.
Additionally, an option window will open that allows you to change the color of the rectangle that you are drawing. You can minimize this window by clicking the arrow in the top right corner of it. If the window is obscuring important parts of your page, you can move it around by drag and drop.
Permanent mode
In default mode, your drawn rectangles disappear as soon as you release your mouse button. If you activate "permanent mode" by checking the box in the options window, all your rectangles will stay on the page.
You can remove individual rectangles by clicking them. To remove all rectangles, disable "permanent mode" again or press the "C" key on your keyboard.
Disable
If you want to stop using the Selection Rectangle Highlighting functionality and want to access the content of the page as usual, you can either click the extension icon once again, click the "X" in the options window, or hit the "Escape" key on your keyboard.
Limitations
By design of the Chrome browser, you cannot use this extensions on any Chrome Web Store page or on internal pages with chrome:// URLs. If you want to use it on local file:// URL pages, you need to manually authorize this in the Chrome extension management area.
Keyboard shortcuts
ESC ... disable drawing mode and close options window
1-6 ... change the rectangle color with the number keys from 1 to 6
P ... enable/disable permanent mode
C ... clear all rectangles in permanent mode
H ... hides/unhides the options window
